author: sessionizill
title: Decentralized Music Platform
description: Music biz infrastructure is bloated. Spotify dictates a price for art they did not help to create. Artist should transact directly w/ fans.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a great proposal that could outcompete classic platforms like Spotify in the long term. 
A lot of costs would be excluded because record companies could directly interact with users. 
The platform would be able to onboard music labels and expand this way. Doing this on the Cardano blockchain could significantly impact the music industry and create a community influx.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers had contact with 2 major music labels who have expressed interest in using this platform. This increases the feasibility of this project greatly. Development for this project is covered by a plutus engineer.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal holds the basics to track success after funding. There is a roadmap and general outline of the budget. There is great additional info in the comments section, especially related to licensing. 
Further detail on the the budget breakdown and setting the KPIs a little bit clearer could elevate this proposal's quality.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge. 

This is really a good idea and might be (if successfully implemented) groundbreaking and disrupting for centralized monopoly of many companies such as Spotify.

The solution to the problem stated (to have Direct2consumer music and no middlemen between artists and fans) is in align with cardanos vision of an alternative economic standard for the world in different business domains. The youtube video added to the proposal gives a very good detailed information on both the current problems in music industry and potential solution to this problem via blockchain technology.

Full points from my side.
f6_assessments.q1:
I agree that the proposer has the experience (business domain) and has collaborated with one of the blockchain tech companies who will provide the implementation side of the functionality.

The tech lead for this project given has public profile given, although would have been better if his website link was posted here on the proposal itself :) . As a senior developer myself, i could see that he comes from a infrastructure background, and holds a BS degree in software engineering, but i have some concerns when it comes to a project of this scale. This kind of project (dapp) would need more experienced technical hands imo. But that is just my opinion.

I think, however, that you could collaborate also with some senior devs for. helping hands with smart contract development and i am sure this project will be implemented successfully. Nevertheless, because of this concern, i give  4 stars:)
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget breakdown is not clearly given, however, i am glad the reasoning behind is mentioned so it is not a concern for community. However, i feel that  community will have ability to track the progress of this product via the proposer. 

However, i can see that the 16 weeks plan is given, additionally, a 3-6-12 months roadmap is given. What i am missing is when Smart contract development will be done ? If 16 weeks are spent with web app, iOs and testing, that means more than 3 months, after which we expect 1 Record label piloting the software. Are smart contracts already expected by then ? 

I see there are some unclarity, and room for improvements. Implementation of such proposals are most critical in order to fulfil the audit of progress and success of the proposal. I have some concerns here, therefore i can not fully agree with it.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the core challenge in music distribution where the subscribers want free/very cheap music and the artist needs to be compensated. The centralized system has only benefited the middlemen. Blockchain is supposed to remove this bias therefore this proposal is addressing the core challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims 20 years of experience in the music industry and is planning to hire a blockchain developer to develop the intended solution. The proposal is meaningful and its success can be in revolutionary adoption to Cardano. The proposal is workable and the budget of 50 K seems reasonable. With this information, it can be appreciated that the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a clear aim and deliverables. The roadmap for development is not explicit in technical details but the state of outcome is clearly measurable. The progress is simple to monitor. The success can be measured based on the progress of the implementation.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal definitely addressed the challenge, and will attract users to use it. The problem is clearly stated and fits into the Dapps  & Intergrations Challenge. With added video to give the USP(s) of the proposal, this will definitely be a good innovation into the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the proposer 20 years experience in the music business and mentioning to hire Plutus Pioneer Program graduate and Haskell developer Myles Gamez, along with Reactive Space, I believe this will be a possible yet big leap to make. Though, key metrics that are lacking are; how many users do the proposer intend to get when releasing an MVP, what are the risks when approaching major labels in the future, the potential hiring in terms of marketing and business along the line when developing the project. The proposal is like a mix of Vezt + MediaChain, which I think is a big big leap that need more detailed KPI(s) and key metrics to be measured.
f6_assessments.q2: Since the proposer mentioned that half from the budget will be for software development work from www.reactivespace.com (Umar Abbas), it is important to have a detailed breakdown of the other $25,000 budget that will be used to allow confidence in voters to vote in this project. Based on the timeline, a more detailed information (ie; how many users are the proposer planning to get for the prototype - throughout the process of developing - milestones for success, a brief explanation of the tokenomics of Initial Coin Offering and NFT marketplace that will take place). What does success look like down the line? The features that can be input into the platform should also be briefly explain to provide vision for voters. Since I love the idea on bringing a decentralised music platform into the Cardano blockchain, there a key factors that the proposer are missing, such as; the risks to be addressed when there is possible bugs on the smart contract? These will all be essential for a smooth and great auditability, therefore I'm giving a 3.

solution: Direct2consumer music streaming SaaS for labels on Cardano. Peer2peer networks decentralize content & decrease overhead. Artists make more $
experience: Over 20 years in the music business. I've already had conversations with CEOs of two prominent record labels. They want this.
